name: Adaptive Mutation
raw: Consume. Restore a friendly unit to full health then swap Attack and Health.
lore: After the soul within has succumbed to the will of the Wildwood, a Hollow is free to evolve into something more suitable for its eventual purpose, growing new vines or sloughing them off as necessary.

name: Animus of Speed
raw: Quick. Ability: Swiftshot.

name: Animus of Will
raw: Multistrike 2.

name: Awakening Thicket
raw: Friendly units have +20 max health and restore 10 health on Resolve.
lore: A soul, once put to sleep by spores, is trapped by the vines of the Wildwood only to become Awoken. It’s not a very pleasant event to witness, but there is a certain beauty in it all.

name: Awoken Hollow
raw: Summon: Gain 60 max health. Rejuvenate: Cultivate 3.

name: Awoken’s Rail Spike
raw: Consume. Draw X and apply -1 Ember to those cards. Cannot draw additional cards this turn.
lore: Though reluctant at first to allow the Rail to come through the Wildwood, the Edge Priory eventually agreed with me to let it pass and uphold the Covenant with Seraph.

name: Bramble Lash
raw: Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 10x Spikes on friendly units.
lore: A single, concentrated influx of Wildwood sap can enlarge the thorns of an Awoken for a short time. Through some ill-advised experiments, I’ve discovered that several simultaneous injections can have devastating effects.

name: Channelsong
raw: Consume. Draw a unit and apply +20 Attack, +20 Health, and 0 Ember.
lore: The Channelers of the Wildwood prefer to keep their involvement in its growth to a minimum. However, their intervention is sometimes required to achieve more “aggressive” expansion.

name: Cycle of Life
raw: Apply +10 Health and Spikes 8.
lore: When a soul is trapped by vines, the Wildwood gives it new life. And when the soul is released after the vines wilt away, that life is returned to the Wildwood and the others trapped within it.

name: Edge Prior
raw: Healing and Regen spells cost -1 Ember on this floor.

name: Engraft
raw: Restore 1 health. Gain 1 Ember. Draw +1 next turn.
lore: When in a dangerous situation, the Awoken sometimes cannot afford the time it takes to regrow limbs. While less effective, they will splice together severed appendages in favor of speed, but in my experience the binding does not last long.

name: Ensnare
raw: Apply Rooted 1. Draw +1 next turn.
lore: The Wildwood of Hell encases those that linger too long underneath its draping canopy. These living trees scare me more than I care to admit.

name: Focused Growth
raw: Restore 20 health, twice. Draw +2 next turn.
lore: I’ve observed from those of the Wildwood that with great concentration comes great healing. The Awoken can channel their will into sprouting spores on the surface of their form to heal broken parts of their vined bodies.

name: Glimmer
raw: Restore 3 health to friendly units and deal 3 damage to enemy units.
lore: If struck by a surge of electricity, a Sapwood will crystallize into glass. The sap within will become preserved as a supercharged healing solvent. But I can’t seem to break the glass without losing much of this sap in the process.

name: Husk Hermit
raw: Sweep. Revenge: +3 attack.

name: Invigorating Solution
raw: Consume. Draw +3 next turn.
lore: After their first visit aboard my train, the Edge Priory concocted a solution of Wildwood sap and condensed train steam to coax more performance from the Boneshaker’s engines.

name: Oldgrowth
raw: Rejuvenate: Gain 10 max health. +10 max health.

name: Preserved Thorns
raw: Consume. Add 3 Sting spells to your hand.
lore: Through my research, I’ve learned that Wildwood sap can extend the efficacy of thorns. This has led to my preservation of thorns in sap for later use.

name: Pyre Shards
raw: Consume. Apply Spikes 10.
lore: To protect the Pyre should it ever feel threatened, I enhanced it to change its shape into something sharper that would damage the attacker. If broken off, these shards can be ingested by the Awoken to achieve the same effect.

name: Pyre-Gro
raw: Consume. Draw -2 next turn.+1 Ember per turn for the rest of battle.
lore: The Sentient once told me that the Wildwood was created when Pyre shards were scattered throughout the soil, fertilizing it with an otherworldly energy. Repeating that process now has a similar, though reduced, effect.

name: Razorsharp Edge
raw: Apply +12 Attack and -2 Health.
lore: Dried out vines can deal more deadly blows, but they risk shattering more easily than their hydrated counterparts. My efforts at strengthening these embrittled appendages have proven fruitless.

name: Restoration Detonation
raw: Restore 15 health to a friendly unit. Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 5x the amount healed.
lore: Though usually avoided because of its potentially deadly outcome, an Awoken’s ability to impale themselves with thorns allows them to become a walking nest of spores. Upon bursting, the spores provide additional life with the extra benefit of damage to those nearby.

name: Restore
raw: Restore 4 health. Apply Regen 2.
lore: One of the many strengths of the Channelers of the Wildwood is their ability to heal their fellow Awoken. Upon our completion of the Rail, they agreed to extend this practice to other Hellborne in need.

name: Restoring Retreat
raw: Restore 25 health. Descend.
lore: After inhabiting the Boneshaker for some time, the Awoken vines have implanted themselves throughout the train. This allows them, and our enemies, to travel great distances in a short amount of time, recharging in the process.

name: Rootseeds
raw: Apply +2 Attack. Draw +1 next turn.
lore: In one of these dreams, that I’m beginning to believe are visions of the past, Wyldenten showed me the creation of the Wildwood itself: seeds taken from Wyldenten’s own body. His final gift before his Exile.

name: Shard Channeler
raw: Spikes on friendly units deal +1 damage per stack.

name: Sharpen
raw: Apply +6 Attack and Spikes 6.
lore: I’ve found discarded Hollow armor serves as a perfect tool to sharpen dull weapons.

name: Shattered Shell
raw: Sweep. Slay: +3 Attack.

name: Spreading Spores
raw: Restore 3 health. Apply Regen 3 and Spikes 3. Add a copy of this card to your discard pile.
lore: When thorns find their mark, they release spores into the air to incapacitate unsuspecting victims. These poor souls soon transform into Awoken and feed the vines that first spread the spores. On the embarrassingly frequent occasions that I’m stung by these thorns, I remove them before any real damage occurs.

name: Steel Enhancer
raw: Apply +4 Attack and +4 Health.
lore: I’ve used Wildwood sap as a mild steel polish as well, providing combat benefits to the Awoken that receive my treatment.

name: Steelsinger
raw: Summon: Gain 80 max health. Rejuvenate: +3 Attack permanently.

name: Sting
raw: Deal 12 damage to the front enemy unit. Draw +1 next turn.
lore: Some trees drop acorns to seed new life - the Awoken shoot thorns. To protect myself, I wore thick leather armor on my first visit to the Wildwood. I can’t say it helped much...

name: Swiftshot
raw: Attack any enemy unit immediately.

name: Thorned Hollow
raw: Summon: Gain 60 max health. Rejuvenate: Gain Spikes 4.

name: Unleash the Wildwood
raw: Restore friendly units to full health.
lore: The vines of the Wildwood stockpile harvested energy to use during unexpected droughts. When these stores are tapped into, the energy provides a surge of new life and power to the host.

name: Vine Grasp
raw: Advance. Deal 3 damage.
lore: Vined Awoken have been known to lash out to control their enemies. While not an enemy, I too have been lashed and it is a less than pleasant experience.

name: Vinemother
raw: End of Turn: Sting spells in your deck gain +4 Magic Power. Ability: Vinewrath.

name: Vinewrath
raw: Add 2 Sting spells to your hand.

name: Wildwood Custodian
raw: Draw +1 each turn.

name: Wildwood Sap
raw: Consume. Apply Regen 4 and +4 health.
lore: When sap from Wildwood trees is consumed, it imparts the healing power of their reproductive spores. I also quite enjoy its floral sweetness.

name: Wildwood Tome
raw: Consume. Apply Quick.
lore: An ancient text of the Channelers of the Edge Priory, this tome outlines its creation. Sadly, the language is closely guarded by the Priory and I’ve had little luck in translating it.

name: Wilting Sapwood
raw: Revenge: Gain 1 Ember.

name: Avenger
raw: Revenge: Apply Melee Weakness 1 to the attacker.

name: Battle Dancer
raw: Shift: Gain Valor 3.

name: Begone
raw: Retreat the front enemy unit. Apply Melee Weakness 1 to enemy units.
lore: “Will you stop your preaching?!” cried Fel. With a single flutter of her wings, she sent a dozen angels tumbling to the ground.

name: Benediction
raw: Apply Valor 2 and Damage Shield 1 to friendly units.
lore: “I am now the Judge of Souls and I find you all lacking.” said Seraph. “Do not worry, I will rectify your flaws.”

name: Bloodsoaked Arena
raw: Friendly units gain Valor 6 on Slay.
lore:
The Crimson Arena claimed many disobedient angels, whether by combat or by fall. Those who proved their worth became useful champions, but always held under a tight leash. 
—Tome of the Lost Path

name: Challenge
raw: Advance. Apply Melee Weakness 1.
lore:
“The new recruit stood on the bodies of her fallen enemies and pointed towards the Walls. Although she spoke no words, the challenge to Heaven was clear.”
—Tome of the Lost Path

name: Cleave
raw: Deal damage to enemy units equal to Attack of the front friendly unit.
lore: “Although my brother taught me that strength is in dominion, the Banished proved that true might is in our unity.”

name: Cursed Twinblade
raw: Multistrike 1. Strike: -1 Attack.
lore:
“She told me the blades would kill me. I laughed and took the weapon. I was living on borrowed time anyway.”
—Finna the Doomed

name: Deadly Plunge
raw: Consume. Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 3x this unit's Health and Armor.
lore:
“When all seemed lost, Commander Fel descended on our enemies with a divine strike.”
—Tome of the Lost Path

name: Death's Dancer
raw: Shift: Apply +4 Attack to friendly units.

name: Deathmetal Hymnist
raw: Enchant: Grant Multistrike 1.

name: Demonic Fledgling
raw: Strike: Gain Valor 1. Shift: Gain Rage 2.

name: Demonize
raw: Descend. Apply Melee Weakness 2.
lore:
“Should I ever return to Heaven, will my brethren still consider me one of their own?”
—Talos

name: Divine Dancer
raw: Shift: Apply Armor 5 to friendly units.

name: Divinity
raw: Apply Valor 10.
lore: Fel bathed her warriors with an unfamiliar light. Heaven’s Light, usually harsh and blinding, became soft. Her warriors sensed it, perhaps Heaven’s Light had found a new steward.

name: Eagleheart
raw: Consume. Advance. Apply Valor 5 to a friendly unit, then it attacks immediately.
lore: “And as she was lifted in the air, Fel felt the will of her soldiers give her strength.” —Tome of the Lost Path

name: Everlasting Light
raw: Strike: Apply Valor 2 to friendly units.
lore:
“I gripped my spear, knowing they would take it away from me. They blamed it for my success in the arena. In the end, I gave it to Talos. May it serve her as well as it did I.”
—Finna the Doomed

name: Fel
raw: Multistrike 1.

name: Firebrand
raw: Revenge: Gain Valor 2.

name: Flight
raw: Move to a targeted location on any floor.

name: Heavenly Slam
raw: Move to a targeted location on any floor. Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to this unit's Health and Armor.

name: Heavensward
raw: Consume. Asced friendly units, then Advance the highest health friendly unit on the new floor.

name: Heroic Dive
raw: Consume. Descend then Advance a friendly unit. Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 2x this unit's Health and Armor.
lore: “I flew past arrows until I found Talos defending the southern gate. The sight of her wounds pushed me forward. I called upon my strength. I was almost there, she only had to hold on!”

name: Hostguard
raw: Ability: Heavenly Slam.

name: Imprisoned Zephyr
raw: Friendly units Advance on Strike.
lore: “Before they were corrupted, many angels were sent to the dungeons of Heaven to test their loyalty to Seraph. Many did not survive.”

name: Inspire
raw: Apply Valor 1 to friendly units.
lore: To the surprise of all, it was Talos who stood before her fellow soldiers and urged them to continue fighting. “For our homes, for our lives, and for a united future!” she cried.

name: Just Cause
raw: Advance. Apply Valor 2.
lore:
“Put away that toy, sister. You’ve never been able to fight me.”
“Maybe before I couldn’t. But now, I must.”

name: Lead Songbird
raw: Valor on friendly units adds +1 Attack per stack.

name: Liquid Courage
raw: Apply Damage Shield 1 and Valor 4.
lore: Sunlight with a sprinkle of courage in a bottle.

name: Penitent's Bloodsuit
raw: Shift: Take 30 damage. Can be equipped on enemy units.
lore: “I regarded the Bloodsuit and felt myself shudder. This instrument of pain had left a mark on many angels in Heaven, it was time we used it for our own purposes.” —Finna the Doomed

name: Penitent's Deathsuit
raw: Shift: Gain Melee Weakness 1. Can be equipped on enemy units.
lore:
“No angel could survive this device. And I was the monster who created it. Perhaps I truly was more a demon now.”
—Finna the Doomed

name: Punk Shredder
raw: Enchant: Grant Trample.

name: Rising Rage
raw: Ascend then Advance.
lore: A simmering fury bubbled in the angel’s throat. “You clipped my wings,” they cried, their voice echoing against Heaven’s high walls, “but now I fly higher than ever before!”

name: Sanctuary
raw: Consume. Apply Damage Shield 2 to friendly units.
lore:
“The Outpost would become a sanctuary for all those threatened by Heaven—be they Angel or Demon—and a place of safety from the plague that had consumed the Empyrial Palace.”
—Tome of the Lost Path

name: Savior
raw: Advance. Gain Valor 5. Gain Armor equal to 1x Valor.

name: Savior II
raw: Advance. Gain Valor 15. Gain Armor equal to 1x Valor.

name: Savior III
raw: Advance. Gain Valor 15. Friendly units gain Armor equal to 1x Fel's Valor.

name: Selfless Sacrifice
raw: Consume. Advance. Apply Damage Shield 2.
lore:
“When you have no more weapons in your arsenal, all you can offer is yourself.”
—Banished motto

name: Shield of Wyngh
raw: Revenge: Deal damage to the attacker equal to this unit's Health.
lore: If the Windblades are the piercing gust of a storm, then the Shield of Wyngh is the gale that deflects any attacker.

name: Slam
raw: Advance. Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to this unit's current Health and Armor.

name: Spike of the Banished
raw: Consume. Apply 4 X Valor.
lore:
“Talos asked me if I was certain. Once the Spike was in the Rail, we would forever be tied to the clans of Hell. I nodded. This is what Herzal would have wanted.”
—Tome of the Lost Path

name: Steadfast Crusader
raw: Ability: Slam.

name: Swordmaiden
raw: Summon: Draw an equipment card from your deck. Artificer: Gain Valor 8.

name: Talos
raw: Ability: Flight.

name: Tome of the Lost Path
raw: Consume. Apply Ability: Flight to a friendly unit.
lore:
“If one day I fall, I hope that this record will remind future fighters of the sacrifices Finna made to save them.”
—Tome of the Lost Path

name: Upbeat Warbler
raw: Enchant: Grant Quick

name: Windblade
raw: Shift: Gain Valor 1.
lore: None can escape the Windblade’s path, whose blade turns a breeze into a slice and a gust into a cut. For who can dodge the very air they breathe?

name: Wyngh's Radiance
raw: Advance. Apply X Melee Weakness.
lore: With an aching heart, Lieutenant Talos lifted her old friend’s spear and prayed to Wyngh for protection. She felt a familiar warmth fill her heart. Perhaps it was her friend, not Wyngh, who answered.

name: Alloy of the Ancients
raw: Consume. Apply Armor 30.
lore: An alloy of unknown components said to come from the ancient Umbra. Some demons choose to drink it while others just pour it over themselves, letting the alloy create a natural defense.

name: Alpha Fiend
raw: Strike: +15 Attack.

name: Apex Imp
raw: Armored: Gain Rage equal to gained Armor. Summon: Gain Armor 5.

name: Battering Ram
raw: Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 4x Armor on friendly units.
lore: Working with the Railbeaters, I was able to devise a series of interlocking shields that turn the Hellhorned into a mobile battering ram.

name: Branded Warrior
raw: Rage 5. Slay: Apply Rage 5 to friendly units.

name: Branding Rite
raw: Piercing. Deal 3 damage. Apply Armor 20.
lore: The focused application of heat on a Hellhorned hide will force it to calcify and provide a natural defense. Though I can tell you that the smell is truly...unique.

name: Consumer of Crowns
raw: Ability: Warlord's Tithe.

name: Culling I
raw: Attack immediately.

name: Culling II
raw: Attack immediately.

name: Culling III
raw: Attack immediately.

name: Dark Deal
raw: Deal 5 damage. Apply Rage 7.
lore: Even the residents of Hell serve something darker and more ancient than themselves. They make deals with the Shroud of the Crucible for metals they can find nowhere else.

name: Demon Fiend
raw: Trample.

name: Deranged Brute
raw: Rage on friendly units adds +3 Attack per stack.

name: Enflame
raw: Apply Rage 6 and Armor 10.
lore: Deep within the Scorched Plains, Hellhorned Demons can sometimes be seen performing a “magma-walk” - a bizarre coming-of-age ritual involving full submersion into lava and a focused trek across the Plain. It’s unbelievable that any Demons survive the ritual, but those that do are stronger for it.

name: Fledgling Imp
raw: Summon: Apply Rage 5 to friendly units.

name: Fortified Pauldrons
raw: Armor 6. Resolve: Gain Armor 6.
lore: Leather is a common material among the Hellhorned, so I’ve lined my garb with the material for protection. Given the stench, I’m sure the source of it is better left a mystery.

name: Hidden Passage
raw: Ascend.
lore: Not all routes through the Boneshaker are immediately recognizable. I sealed many of them off to all but those who are willing to tear through steel and squeeze through the shreds.

name: Horn Break
raw: Piercing. Deal 8 damage, twice.
lore: A defeated opponent’s horns are broken as a ritualistic act of dominance. The horns are then collected by the victor as a trophy.

name: Horned Warrior
raw: Multistrike 1.

name: Imp-in-a-Box
raw: Consume. Add 2 random Imp units to your hand.
lore: Whoever thought to put imps in a confined space had clearly never interacted with the little devils. That didn’t stop me from keeping a few boxes. Though, every once in a while, one finally does get out.

name: Imp-olate
raw: Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 25x the number of Imp units in your deck.
lore: “Imps die for their horns to grow large. Demons die for their horns to grow sharp.” -excerpt from Hell’s Horns by Grrrg Onehorn, discussing the cyclical life of a Hellhorned and how their horns mature.

name: Imp-portant Work
raw: Sacrifice Imp. Gain 1 Ember. Draw 1.
lore: “Some Imps learn much about Horned. It is only through dying that Imps can teach Horned.” -excerpt from Hell’s Horns by Grrrg Onehorn on the posthumous transfer of knowledge in Hellhorned society.

name: Imp-pressive
raw: Attuned. Sacrifice Imp. Deal 50 damage to the front enemy unit.
lore: “Some Imps eat Pyre. While Pyre tasty, Pyre not endless. Hungry imps then eaten by Pyre. And life continues.” -excerpt from Hell’s Horns by Grrrg Onehorn on Pyre-eating etiquette.

name: Impish Scholar
raw: Summon: Return a random consumed spell to your hand.

name: Inferno
raw: Piercing. Deal 120 damage to all units.
lore: The Scorched Plains are known for frequent firestorms that can rain down at any moment, striking anyone unlucky enough to be caught below. This has made my travels through it particularly short.

name: Last Stand
raw: Double the amount of Rage on friendly units.
lore: It’s impossible for the Hellhorned to regain their standing after their horns have been broken, but that doesn’t mean they can’t fight back against their aggressor to salvage what remains of their reputation.

name: March of Shields
raw: Advance. Apply Armor 12.
lore: Only the bravest, or dumbest, Hellhorned are chosen to bear a shield and hold the line. They are trained to take the brunt of most attacks through an intense regimen of magma-walking that kills more often than not.

name: Molting Imp
raw: Summon: Deal 10 damage to enemy units.

name: Onehorn’s Tome
raw: Consume. Apply Fragile and Multistrike 1 to a friendly unit.
lore: “Hell’s Horns, History of the Hellhorned”, by Grrrg Onehorn. The terrible handwriting of the imp scribes has made this tome an excruciating read and something I don’t plan on returning to soon.

name: Pyre Chomper
raw: Summon: Gain 4 Ember.

name: Queen's Impling
raw: Summon: Deal 16 damage to the front enemy unit.

name: Rage Room
raw: Friendly units gain Rage 2 on Strike and Revenge.

name: Rage Serum
raw: Consume. Apply Rage 5.
lore: Some Hellhorned grind the horns they’ve won and steep a potion for additional strength. It is a foul substance that I’ve had the distinct misfortune to try, but the Hellhorned can’t seem to get enough.

name: Railbeater
raw: Armor 30. Strike: Apply Melee Weakness 1 to the attacked unit.

name: Reinforce
raw: Double the amount of Armor on a unit.
lore: Armor forged by Hellhorned steelworkers is among the sturdiest defense known to Hell. It is not, however, known to be particularly comfortable, so the Hellhorned wear it only when absolutely necessary.

name: Ritual of Battle
raw: Apply Rage 12.
lore: I have learned that the Hellhorned can gain temporary strength through the self-infliction of pain. I find the ritual savage, but it proves to be even more effective when performed over the remains of their opponents.

name: Spike of the Hellhorned
raw: Consume. Apply 4X Rage and 4X Armor.
lore: In an act of unity unheard of in Hellhorned culture, Grrrg the Railbeater snapped his own horn to seal the Rail in their Ring, bringing the Hellhorned into our Covenant. Grrrg the Railbeater was thereafter known as Grrrg Onehorn.

name: Steelworker
raw: Resolve: Apply Armor 6 to friendly units.

name: Tiresome Climb
raw: Ascend. Apply Dazed 2.
lore: Alongside the few remaining Hellhorned scholars, I designed the Boneshaker to change its shape at will, creating hallways that stretch to near infinity for the Winged who choose to walk them.

name: Torch
raw: Deal 3 damage.
lore: The Hellhorned have learned to live with the unpredictability of the Scorched Plains, even going so far as to retain some of the flaming boulders for themselves, despite my attempts to dissuade them.

name: Transcendimp
raw: When played, repeat all Summon effects triggered so far this battle.

name: Vent
raw: Deal 5 X damage to enemy units.
lore: The Boneshaker is of my own design. Fueled by the last shards of the Pyre, the train is robust and dependable. One of its lesser-known features is the ability to unleash pressurized steam on invaders.

name: Warlord's Tithe
raw: Sacrifice Imp. Attack Immediately.

name: Welder Helper
raw: Summon: Apply Armor 20 to the front friendly unit.

name: Acid Shower
raw: Apply Unstable 10 and deal 1 damage to enemy units.
lore:
“If water gets in your eyes, rinse them out immediately with acid.”
—OHELL Safety Regulations and Guidelines

name: Blast Infusion
raw: Infusion. Purge. Apply Unstable 5.
lore:
“I did not anticipate that my concoction would be so explosive, but I am happy with the result. Best to keep it a secret. My assistants would not understand.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Brain Transfer
raw: Sacrifice. Transfer Attack and all Buff and Debuff effects to front friendly unit.
lore:
“While a body can still be usable if preserved correctly, brain matter must be transferred to a host within hours.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Brew
raw: Mix.

name: Combustion Suit
raw: Strike: Apply Unstable 5 to enemy units.
lore:
“Per code LLH 2019.11, assistants must wear this suit at all times when applying the Destabilization Spray. The mixture tends to unbalance their minds.”
—OHELL Safety Regulations and Guidelines

name: Devour
raw: Sacrifice Assistant. Gain their Attack.

name: Devour II
raw: Sacrifice Assistant. Gain twice their Attack.

name: Devour III
raw: Sacrifice Assistant. Gain three times their Attack.

name: Double-Edged Arms
raw: Multistrike 1.
lore: Inspired by the Hell Lobster’s own appendages, these pincers can grip, cut, and twist the most stubborn of materials.

name: Double-Edged Bearer
raw: Graft: Double-Edged Arms.

name: Electricity Chamber
raw: Friendly units gain Spikes 8 on Summon and Reanimate.
lore:
“When an assistant has fallen, take them to the chamber so that their bodies can be 
reawakened with a little zap.”
—OHELL Safety Regulations and Guidelines

name: Enfeebling Infusion
raw: Infusion. Purge. Apply Sap 1.
lore:
“It took a lot of kitten whiskers but I finally made a drink that cripples a subject. Now, what will I do with all these adorable felines?”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Erratic Assistant
raw: Graft: Scissor Hands.

name: Explosive Reaction
raw: Apply Unstable 25. Deal 5 damage.
lore:
“My contraption taps into the celestial core of angels and makes them... well, let’s just say they put on a good light show.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Faulty Body
raw: Consume. Apply Fragile and Spikes 40 to a friendly unit.
lore:
“Poor Baron, he found a way to strengthen his love’s frail body but, just as beryllium is strong yet fragile, so too became Inga.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Forevermore Serum
raw: Consume. Apply Reanimate 1.
lore:
“The serum was meant to get rid of my wrinkles but ended up doing so much more.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Goliath Infusion
raw: Infusion. Purge. Apply Rage 4.
lore:
“This is the one. This will make Inga better. But first, I must test it on myself…”
—Baron Grael

name: Hookhand
raw: Advance. Apply Dazed 1.

name: Horrify
raw: Retreat. Apply Dazed 1.
lore: “Stay back! Stay back, you monster!” cried the assistant. “I’m not a monster. I’m Grael!” he cried. “Don’t you recognize me?!”

name: Huge Concoction
raw: Mix three times.

name: Hulking Mass
raw: Armor 40. Reanimated: Gain Armor 40.

name: Hydra Armed Horror
raw: Equipped: The equipment is removed. Gain Multistrike 1.

name: Insatiable Hunger
raw: Friendly units gain Lifesteal 2.
lore:
“Some return from the Reanimation Lab with a peculiar hunger that consumes their minds. My assistant Hugo implores that we stop and that our efforts are forbidden.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebooks

name: It's Alive!
raw: Advance. Apply Lifesteal 1 and +7 Attack.
lore:
“When I awoke, I did not remember anything of my previous life. It was as if I had been born anew! And this time, I had a few extra special ‘upgrades,’ if you will.”
—Hugo, assistant to Dr. Orechi

name: Madman Infusion
raw: Infusion. Purge. Apply Regen 2.
lore:
“After what this did to Inga’s mind, I destroyed every bottle. Or, I thought I did.”
—Baron Grael

name: Makeshift  Golem
raw: Armor 12. Extinguish: Apply Armor 12 to friendly units.

name: Meathook
raw: Ability: Hookhand.

name: Medium Concoction
raw: Mix twice.

name: Minds Of Their Own
raw: Equipped friendly units attack immediately.
lore: A scraping sound, like a dead fish being dragged across a plank, caused Hugo to turn. He froze. The hand he had just collected was gone!

name: Mix-a-Lot
raw: Mix 5 times, randomly selecting each infusion.

name: Mixology
raw: Mix twice.
lore:
“I must admit, I do find myself sometimes getting a little whimsical with my concoctions. Just look at my Hair-Lifting Blueberry Fizzes!”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Nine-Lived Nightmare
raw: Reanimate 8.

name: Organ Harvester
raw: Slay: Gain Reanimate 1.
lore:
“My experiments tend to take a toll on my the bodies of my assistants. I made this contraption so I could collect new parts with more efficiency.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Overworked Assistant
raw: Reanimate 1. Incant: Gain Unstable 4.

name: Pincushion
raw: Equipped: +3 Attack and +3 Health permanently.

name: Plague Doctor
raw: Strike: Apply Unstable equal to the damage dealt.

name: Potion Kit
raw: Ability: Brew.
lore:
“An essential collection of tools that every lab technician needs: powdered Titan bone, a beaker, a faulty burner, and chili, of course.”
—OHELL Safety Regulations and Guidelines

name: Pseudoscience
raw: Randomly apply either Lifesteal 2, Reanimate 1, or Spikes 6.
lore: “I’m not sure how it works but I do know that, for some reason, shaking a bottle and making baby noises at my specimens makes them heal faster.”

name: Pufferflesh
raw: Graft: Spiky Skin.

name: Reanimation Lab
raw: Friendly units gain +7 Attack and +7 Health on Summon and Reanimate.
lore: The deepest and most secretive part of Orechi’s lab. Only a few of his most trusted assistants are allowed inside and seem happy for the privilege. His other employees pray they never go there.

name: Reforming Ooze
raw: Reanimate 1. Reanimated: +6 Attack permanently.

name: Replicator Ray
raw: Consume. Remove equipment from a friendly unit. Copy the unit.
lore:
“I found that I was burning, sometimes quite literally, through assistants faster than I liked. I made this little contraption to turn one assistant into two!”
—Dr. Orechi

name: Risky Operation
raw: Reduce friendly unit to 1 health. Apply +10 Attack and Lifesteal 2.
lore:
“Fascinating! The subject barely survived but look how strong they are!”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Sanguine Assistant
raw: Graft: Vampire's Tooth.

name: Scissor Hands
lore: “Well, at least making confetti will be easy.”

name: Scrap for Parts
raw: Consume. Sacrifice. Draw a unit and apply +40 Attack and 0 Ember.
lore:
“All these under-performing technicians are still good for something.”
—Dr. Orechi

name: Secret Ingredient
raw: Mix.
lore: Not all ingredients in this concoction are rare, fragile, or even illegal. Sometimes all you need is a bit of salt to make a potion all the more potent.

name: Small Concoction
raw: Mix.

name: Spike of the League
raw: Apply 1 X Reanimate.
lore: Once, Dr. Orechi was someone who would bristle at the thought of his creations being used for war. He sighed and drove his spike into the Rail. Times had changed.

name: Spiky Skin
raw: Revenge: Gain Spikes 3.
lore:
“I took a sample from a demon’s flesh whose skin was as strong as steel and combined it with a bristle brush. Voila! My sharpest creation!”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Surgical Strike
raw: Piercing. Deal 4 damage. Slay: Add a copy of this card with Ephemeral to your hand.
lore:
“I‘ve found that the scalpel is mightier than the sword. It can cut with more deadly precision.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Test Subject Alpha
raw: Quick. Sweep.

name: Tome of Horrors
raw: Consume. Apply Unstable 50 and Reanimate 1.
lore:
“My assistant gifted me this journal so I could take meticulous notes of my experiments. He might have also said ‘writing would help process my feelings.’ I didn’t pay much attention.”
—Dr. Orechi

name: Twisted Assistant
raw: Graft: Twisted Back.

name: Twisted Back
raw: Trample. Strike: Gain Rage 2.
lore: “I’ve been Dr. Orechi’s intern for years now. When will I get an actual job offer?!”

name: Vampire's Tooth
raw: Lifesteal 1. Resolve: Gain Lifesteal 1.
lore:
“The name is a little tongue-in-cheek, my assistant wanted eternal life so I made her an implant that would let her, let’s say, ‘drink the life force’ of others.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Weaponized Prosthetic
raw: Remove equipment from a unit. Apply +30 Attack.
lore: “Look, Mom! Isn’t my new arm cool?”

name: Arduhn
raw: Mageblade 2.

name: Astrologer
raw: Mooncycle: +5 Attack.

name: Aurora Weaver
raw: Mooncycle: Gain Conduit 1.

name: Bloody Moon
raw: Deal 25 damage. Slay: Gain 2 Ember.
lore:
“When Seraph came to destroy our home, the moon shone red. At the sight, Lady Ekka grieved the souls that would fall in the upcoming battle.”
—Ardania the Forbidden

name: Celestial Storm
raw: Deal 10 damage to enemy units. Full Moon: Attuned.
lore:
“Lady Ekka fell silent as she called upon her ancient ally: the sky. Seraph’s army had underestimated her might.”
 —Ardania the Forbidden

name: Cosmic Bolt
raw: Attuned. Deal 35 damage.
lore: A flash was all the warning Seraph got.

name: Coven's Spike
raw: Consume. Apply 3 X Conduit.
lore:
“I wove Ekka’s sash around the shard of our shattered moon and drove it into the Rail. With that, Hell would be our home now.”
—Arduhn, Head Guard of the Silent

name: Cover of Night
raw: Phase to New Moon. Apply +5 Attack and Stealth 1 to friendly units.
lore: Seraph’s soldier turned, having heard a sound behind him. He froze. There, perched atop a moon cliff, was a creature, unlike any demon or angel he had ever seen.

name: Duality
raw: Attuned. Deal 10 damage to an enemy unit or restore 10 health to a friendly unit.
lore:
“Silent or Selene, magic user or fighter, we are each a part the whole.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Dusk Mantle
raw: New Moon: Titanskin 5

name: Eclipse Chamber
raw: New Moon effects are always active. Silent units gain +15 Attack on Resolve.
lore:
“The angels found us waiting for them. I brought up my shield. The coven priestesses would be protected. If they failed to bring the eclipse, we were doomed.”
—Ardania the Forbidden

name: Ethereal Seelie
raw: Conduit 5. Apply +1 stack of Conduit each time it is applied.

name: Fae's Blessing
raw: Restore 5 health. Healing over max health applies Armor instead.
lore: Arduhn stretched out his hand towards the fae, who touched him in return. And so a pact was made. The fae would assist the coven so they could return home.

name: Glittering Draught
raw: Consume. Restore 20 health and apply Conduit 4.
lore:
“Once done, this draught will transform sunlight into moonlight and heal a fae of any wound.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Gravity
raw: Deal 5 damage. New Moon: Descend. Full Moon: Ascend.
lore:
“Seraph had defeated us and left us with no choice. If we could no longer rise above Heaven and Hell, we would have to fall.”
—Ardania the Forbidden

name: Heavenfall
raw: Deal 80 damage to enemy units. Full Moon: Deal damage on all floors instead.
lore:
“If I must fall, may I at least grant you time to escape.”
—last words of Ardania, forbidden younger sister of Arduhn and Ekka

name: Hexscalation
raw: Ascend. Apply Spell Weakness 2.
lore:
“Draw the runes on the ground and wait for your enemy to arrive. They will be welcomed by a nasty surprise.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Luna Cyclestaff
raw: Mooncycle: This equipment gains +1 Attack permanently.
lore:
“Under a full moon, take the staff made of the lunar shard and cast a circle. Watch the sands of Limbo flow towards you. A moon will be made for your coven to call home.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Lunacy
raw: Phase X times. Apply 1 X Conduit.
lore:
“Some believe that the Selene control the moon and her phases. What lunacy. The moon can not be forced to do what she does not wish. Time, on the other hand, can be manipulated.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Lunar Echo
raw: Create an Ephemeral copy of a random spell played last turn.

name: Lunar Priestess
raw: Resolve: Add a Moon Ritual spell with Ephemeral to your hand.

name: Meddler
raw: Summon: Phase. Ability: Moonipulate.

name: Moon Pixie
raw: Conduit 3. Enchant: Grant Conduit 3.

name: Moon Ritual
raw: Phase. Apply Conduit 1 to a friendly unit.
lore:
“Each new moon phase calls for a new ritual with your fellow fae.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Moonbeam
raw: Deal 20 damage to the front enemy unit X times.
lore:
“As our beloved moon fell, our home had one last gift to give our coven. When it shattered, all the magic we had stored inside struck Seraph.”
—Ardania, fallen guard to Lady Ekka

name: Mooncaller
raw: Mooncycle triggers an additional time.

name: Moonguard
raw: Mageblade 3. New Moon: Mageblade 3.

name: Moonipulate
raw: Phase.

name: Moonipulate
raw: Phase.

name: Moonlit Glaive
raw: Mageblade 3.
lore: At the end of the Plenilune, the priestess return all weapons to the Silent. For now that the blades have been blessed by the Empress Moon, they have no place in her temple.

name: Moonrise
raw: Consume. Gain 1 Ember. Phase to Full Moon.
lore:
“I wove the cloth across my wrists and waited for the moon to rise. As I saw it peak over the horizon, my powers grew.” 
—The Ritual Tome

name: Nightingale
raw: Stealth 2. New Moon: Multistrike 2.

name: Planetarium
raw: Grant friendly units Conduit 5.
lore: The home of the Astrologers and where they pore over star charts and judge who was born under a auspicious moon.

name: Ritual Tome
raw: Cosume. Apply Titanskin 2 to a friendly unit.
lore:
“May all fae, noble and not, write their spells in this tome. For each voice belongs to the coven’s chorus.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Scrivener
raw: Ability: Spellweave.

name: Selene Acolyte
raw: Mageblade 2. Full Moon: Sweep.

name: Shadeguard
raw: Resolve: If it is New Moon, gain +10 Attack and +15 Health.

name: Shadowcast
raw: Phase to New Moon.

name: Silent Sentinel
raw: Ability: Spell Slam.

name: Silver Ink
raw: Consume. Apply Attuned and +3 Magic Power to spells in your hand.
lore:
“Take stardust and mix it with oil. Cast a blessing. Only the fae shall read your words written in this ink.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Silver Strike
raw: Deal 25 damage to the front enemy unit. Full Moon: Deal damage twice instead.
lore:
“Our defeat was certain but Lady Ekka urged us to continue until the full moon. Then, she explained, she might be able to alter our fates.”
—Ardania the Forbidden

name: Spell Slam
raw: Restore to full health. Apply Spell Weakness 1 to enemy units.

name: Spellweave
raw: Draw a spell and apply -1 Ember.

name: Stardust Invocation
raw: Consume. Phase. Create an Ephemeral copy of a spell in your hand.
lore:
“Take a handful of stardust and whisper an incantation over it. Your spell’s power will be doubled.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Starstruck
raw: Deal 5 damage. Full Moon: Apply Dazed 1.
lore: “Seraph is at our temple gates! Stars, won’t you protect us?”

name: Sunset
raw: Phase to New Moon.

name: Tidal Turning
raw: Consume. Restore 10 health to friendly units. Healing over max health applies Armor instead.
lore: Moonlit shores attract millions of tiny fae to bathe in the moonlight. As the night deepens, the Selene dance, guided by the water’s glow.

name: Witchweave
raw: Deal 1 damage to an enemy unit or restore 1 health to a friendly unit.
lore: As the fighting continued outside the temple walls, Lady Ekka prepared her strike. “May the moon’s light and darkness unite,” she whispered.

name: A Fatal Melting
raw: Deal damage to enemy units equal to 3x the number of friendly unit deaths this battle.
lore: Charged with both the extension of life and the acceleration of melting, the Reformed tend to large flames at each Votive House, allowing for Waxers to congregate and melt more quickly than they would on their own.

name: Big Sludge
raw: Harvest: Gain Rage 5.

name: Bounty Stalker
raw: Stealth 1. Extinguish: +8 Attack permanently.

name: Crushing Demise
raw: Kill a random non-boss enemy unit. Kill a random friendly unit.
lore: A hazard of guttering at a Votive House is the melding together of various Waxers into a massive, uncontrollable boulder that will kill anything in its path.

name: Cryptcall I
raw: Reform 2 random units and apply an additional +10 attack.

name: Cryptcall II
raw: Reform 2 random units and apply an additional +15 attack.

name: Cryptcall III
raw: Reform 2 random units and apply an additional +25 attack.

name: Devourer of Death
raw: Harvest: Gain Soul 1. Extinguish: Deal damage to enemy units equal to 15x the Soul count.

name: Draff
raw: Burnout 1. Multistrike 1.

name: Dreg
raw: Burnout 2.

name: Dripfall
raw: Descend. Apply Dazed 1.
lore: While Wax Drips are beneficial for those who refuse to melt, getting caught in the downfall can have violent consequences. Consequently, I’ve decided only to study them from a safe distance.

name: Engulfed in Smoke
raw: Apply Stealth 2 to friendly units.
lore: In the dangerous depths of Hell, it’s important to have the means for quick concealment. If needed, I’ve found that wicks bundled together will burn slowly and create large quantities of smoke.

name: Entombed Explosive
raw: Extinguish: Deal 65 damage to the front enemy unit.

name: Formless Child
raw: Extinguish: Return a random defeated unit to your hand and apply +40 Attack.

name: Hallowed Drippings
raw: Consume. Apply Burnout 5 and +5 attack to friendly Burnout units.
lore: Those of the Melting Remnant who want to continue living must attend a Votive House to receive a Blessing of Wax. But on some rare occasions, the Reformed will grant a soul some of the sacred wax for use outside the House.

name: Hallowed Halls
raw: Kill friendly units. Reform random units to this floor until it exceeds its Capacity.
lore: Wurmkin stoneform speaks of passageways deep below those controlled by the Wickless, further even than the caverns of the Reformed. These halls of stone sleep in the dark, their floors covered in the wicks of lost Waxers. Should Wax ever fall from the Ring above, and flame come to the wicks that lay there, a soul is said to live again for a brief moment of time. In my darkest nightmares, I rest in these wicked halls forever flickering between life and death.

name: Intent on Death
raw: Consume. Trigger a unit's Extinguish ability without killing it.
lore: Votive Houses can become crowded and melting away is a long process. To avoid the wait, I’ve seen some Waxers increase the intensity of their flame through extreme focus, though they typically lose consciousness briefly after doing it.

name: Lady of the House
raw: Burnout 3. +5 attack for every stack of Burnout.

name: Lady of the Reformed
raw: Burnout 3. Revenge: Apply Burnout 1 to friendly Burnout units.

name: Legion of Wax
raw: Extinguish: Summon 2 Twin of Wax and apply this unit's upgrades and stat changes.

name: Memento Mori
raw: Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 10x the number of friendly unit deaths this battle.
lore: In memory, a Waxer is never truly dead. Through a process we developed together, their faces are embossed on deadly weapons and serve as a reminder of what once was and what will be.

name: Memorial for the Melted
raw: Friendly units have Endless.
lore: The Reformed, a group of Waxers dedicated to the melting of others, believe in respecting the already melted. The Reformed keep the wicks of each Waxer they’ve helped to melt, burning the wicks briefly to remind themselves of their own impermanence, but extinguishing the wicks quickly to remember that their purpose is not yet fulfilled.

name: Molded
raw: Reform a unit.
lore: Once a Waxer has melted away, only the wick remains. Should these Waxers choose to return to their previous forms, the Reformed will pour new wax into the original molds to revive the remaining wicks’ soul.

name: Molten Encasement
raw: Extinguish: Apply Stealth 2 to friendly units.

name: Mortal Entrapment
raw: Attuned. Deal 25 damage and apply Dazed 3 to an already damaged unit.
lore: While molds are used in the resurrection of Waxen, the invasion of Hell has forced the Waxen to repurpose these molds for a more deadly effect. They are now positioned to trap unsuspecting targets who’ve already been injured, making them easier to encase in the hot wax.

name: Paraffin Enforcer
raw: Strike: Apply Rage 3 to friendly Burnout units.

name: Paraffin Thug
raw: Slay: Gain 30 Gold.

name: Primitive Mold
raw: Reform a random unit.
lore: Fade brought me to the site of a rock split in two. The shape reminded me of the molds used by the Melting Remnant, and the drips of wax made this theory more plausible. Fade says she split the rock because she was bored, but her subsequent silence seems to suggest a more altruistic purpose. Why are they showing me these things?

name: Purifying Cleanse
raw: Restore 15 health and apply Burnout 3 to a friendly unit.
lore: Before entering a wax drip and applying new wax, a process I’ve been told is called “guttering”, Waxers are asked to cleanse themselves of any blemishes and impurities to keep the wax as clean as possible.

name: Remnant Host
raw: Extinguish: Summon 2 Draff units.

name: Remnant Pact
raw: Consume. Apply Endless to a friendly unit.
lore: Despite their age-long feud, the Wickless and the Reformed were able to come to an armistice when the Covenant was formed. That doesn’t mean that the rules put in place for their peace were easy to follow.

name: Resin Blades
raw: Burnout 1. Multistrike 1. Return to hand when equipped unit is destroyed.

name: Resin Removal
raw: Remove all Debuff effects from friendly units and all Buff effects from enemy units.
lore: When wax hardens into resin, it is possible to chip away the crystallized exterior to expose the soft wax underneath. The process does not come without risks, though.

name: Sacred Wicks
raw: Consume. Reform 2 random units.
lore: While a soul of the Melting Remnant can be reformed in waxen molds, they are not truly reborn until they are given a new wick. The Reformed treat the practice of this ritual as highly sacred and secretive and I’ve been able to record little of its specifics.

name: Sacrificial Resurrection
raw: Consume cards in hand. Add a Draff unit to your hand and apply +10 Attack for each card consumed.
lore: When new wax is unavailable to reform a fallen Waxer, the more selfless Reformed choose to donate a portion of their own form to the resurrection.

name: Subsuming Blade
raw: Piercing. Deal 5 damage. Slay: Increase damage by 3 permanently.
lore: This blade grows larger with each use, slowly accumulating more wax and becoming more dangerous. Reluctantly, I created it with the Wickless when Hell was invaded to defend against the advancing Winged.

name: Votivary
raw: Endless. Extinguish: Draw +2 next turn..

name: Waxen Spike
raw: Consume. Apply +4 X Attack and Burnout 4 to friendly units.
lore: The alliance of the Rings of Hell also created an alliance between the Reformed and the Wickless Remains, bringing together the separate groups under Flicker. To seal their pact, they created a Railspike from their collective wax and drove it into our Rail.

name: Wicked Blaze
raw: Reform a unit and apply +10 Attack.
lore: Though not entirely under their control, the burning of a Waxer’s wick can accelerate with a great deal of focus and help from other Waxers. The resulting melting wax is then collected and donated to reform one of their kin.

name: Wicklash
raw: Apply +10 Attack and Burnout 2 to a friendly unit.
lore: Those who truly cannot wait for their wax to melt can fasten additional wicks to their bodies, ensuring they burn with a brief, but beautiful, light.

name: Wickless Baron
raw: Harvest: +5 Attack and +5 Health.

name: Wickless Recruitment
raw: Remove all Burnout and Debuff effects from a unit.
lore: Initiation into the Wickless Remains is a rite performed in the underbelly of the Waxen Arches, involving the sacrifice of a Waxer’s wick to forever tie them to their hellish homeland. Even after the many I’ve witnessed, the ritual still gives me pause.

name: Wickless Tycoon
raw: Harvest: Gain 10 Gold.

name: Alchemy
raw: Consume. Gain 1 Dragon's Hoard.
lore:
“A clever dragon can convince all others that they can make air into gold.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #53

name: Bloated Whelp
raw: Ability: Indigestion.

name: Cursed Dragonstaff
raw: Incant: Deal 1 damage to enemy units.
lore:
“An eye for an eye makes for a cursed eye, better to leave them blind.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #16

name: Deathroar
raw: Transfer all Pyregel on this floor to a unit then deal 5 damage five times.
lore: Lady Gilda turned away from the conversation. Her bodyguard, Vagar, was a loyal dragon but his breath was terrible.

name: Devilish Details
raw: Consume. Gain 3 Dragon's Hoard. Your Pyre takes 8 damage.
lore: “Nothing is off the market, not even the Pyre itself.”

name: Dragon's Breath
raw: Apply Pyregel 10 and deal 10 damage to enemy units.
lore: As Keeper of Hell’s Heart, Fhyra was a tenacious guardian. Those who tried to enter the caves beneath the last circle and steal her treasure would meet a fire hotter than Heaven’s might.

name: Empower
raw: Gain Attack equal to Pyregel stacks on all units.

name: Fanning the Flame
raw: Explosive. Deal 3 damage to a random enemy unit. Slay: Increase damage by 3 permanently.
lore:
“Fan the flames of war. It’s good for business.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #19

name: Fenix Fire
raw: Deal damage equal to this unit's attack. Apply Pyregel 4 to enemy units.

name: Fenix Fire II
raw: Explosive. Deal damage equal to this unit's attack. Apply Pyregel 4 to enemy units.

name: Fenix Fire III
raw: Explosive. Deal damage equal to 2x this unit's attack. Apply Pyregel 4 to enemy units.

name: Fire Breathing
raw: Deal damage equal to this unit's attack to enemy units, twice.

name: Firestarter
raw: Deal 1 damage then apply Pyregel 2.
lore: An incendiary mixture developed by the Pyreborne to add a little spark to battle.

name: Flicker
raw: Deal 1 damage to enemy units.
lore:
“A small flicker can still burn.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #37

name: Gellysneeze
raw: Deal 1 damage then apply Pyregel 12 to the front enemy unit.

name: Gildmonger
raw: Extinguish: Gain 1 Dragon's Hoard.

name: Golden Touch
raw: Deal 5 damage. Slay: Gain 1 Dragon's Hoard.
lore:
“If you have to pay taxes, make sure you bury the tax demon.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #12

name: Goldtooth
raw: Avarice 5. +15 Attack per 100 Gold you started the turn with.

name: Greed
raw: Deal 20 damage to all units. Slay: Gain 10 Gold.
lore: Leave the gold for the dragons or else they’ll add you to their treasure pile.

name: Greed Dragon
raw: Summon: +10 Attack and +10 Health for each Dragon's Hoard.

name: Hellfurnace
raw: When a unit gains Pyregel, it gains +3 stacks.
lore: “We’re behind schedule! Pick it up, double-time!” Fenix’s voice blared from the forge speaker. The dragonsmiths hammered away, determined to meet their quota.

name: Hot Head
raw: Ability: Fire Breathing.

name: Inequivalent Exchange
raw: Deal damage equal to 25x your Dragon's Hoard, then lose 1 Dragon's Hoard.
lore: “Here’s your change,” said a voice. These words were the angel’s only warning before a barrage of coins flew straight towards him.

name: Lava Armor
raw: Revenge: Apply Pyregel 3 to the attacker.
lore:
“Fenix does love to dote on me, but I have to say, my favorite gift was the patent for this armor of his that uses lava to protect the wearer. It’s his most profitable creation yet!”
—Lady Gilda

name: Lava Flow
raw: Consume. Apply Pyregel 4 to enemy units.
lore: When Hell froze, so did the mighty lava river beneath the Pyreborne caves. Once the Pyreborne melted the celestial ice, they restored the river to its ancient might.

name: Lord Fenix
raw: Ability: Fenix Fire.

name: Magma Cultist
raw: Incant: Apply Pyregel 1 to enemy units.

name: Magma Mauler
raw: Strike: Apply Pyregel 8.

name: Make It Rain
raw: Deal 5 damage to enemy units. Spend 5 Gold and repeat this card's effect, up to three more times.
lore: Although it goes against the instincts of every dragon in Hell, sometimes you have to loosen the purse strings to win the battle.

name: Mind Cage
raw: Resolve: Reduce Cooldown by 1.
lore:
“All dragons who turn their thoughts towards pointless pastimes such as art, music, or poetry will submit to the mindcage until they reform.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #3

name: Miser
raw: Avarice 10.

name: Moneymaker
raw: Gain 5 Gold for each Dragon's Hoard.

name: Pay Off
raw: Consume. Restore 2 Pyre health for each Dragon's Hoard.
lore:
“So, you’ll do it?” said Fenix. 
“For a price,” replied the angel. “Though I have to say, I thought you were on the side of Hell.”
Fenix paused. “I’m on my own side,” he said.

name: Pyreball
raw: Explosive. Deal 20 damage.
lore: “Do you think the angels will be able to fly around it?” asked Fenix. “I would like to see them try,” replied Lady Gilda.

name: Pyreblooded
raw: Ability: Empower.

name: Pyreborne Brainspike
raw: Consume. Reduce Cooldown by X. Apply 2 X Avarice.
lore:
“And in your minds, I will hide the true location of my Hoard. However, only those willing to use my key will find it.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #20

name: Pyrecask
raw: Consume. Apply Pyregel 10.
lore: A barrel full of Pyregel is perfect, not just for dousing enemies. It is also a wonderful option to bring to a potluck.

name: Pyreclasm
raw: Attuned. Explosive. Deal 150 damage.
lore:
“And when you have followed my commandments and led a life devoted to gold, then your spirit will experience an explosive transformation.” 
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #1071

name: Sacrificial Chamber
raw: Gain 10 Gold when a unit dies.
lore:
“If a dragon cannot pay their yearly tribute, they will pay their tithe with their life.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #2

name: Smelted Treasure
raw: Spend 50 Gold. Apply Armor 50 to a friendly unit.

name: Snotty Whelp
raw: Ability: Gellysneeze.

name: Soldier of Fortune
raw: Consume. Draw a unit. If you have 30 Gold, spend it to apply +30 Attack, Avarice 15, and Armor 15.
lore: “A soldier who goes to war without the promise of pay is a fool with a sword.” —The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #22

name: Soulsmelter
raw: Siphon: Gain 1 Soul. Celebrate: Gain 1 Dragon's Hoard for every 4 Soul.
lore: A creation by the Pyreborne smelters and infused with a blessing by Fhyra, this staff consumed the souls of the bearer’s enemies and transformed them into gold.

name: Stuck Up Whelp
raw: Ability: Expensive Taste.

name: Superheated
raw: Consume. Double the amount of Pyregel on a unit.
lore:
“Beneath the Pyreborne’s caves flows a river of Pyregel that runs so hot, it erodes the very stone itself. Watch where you step, you might get a superheated surprise.”
—Dante’s Travel Guide

name: Tome of Contracts
raw: Consume. Reduce a unit's Cooldown Timer by 1 to a minimum of 1.
lore:
“All dragons must sign their name in the ledger and give half their yearly coin to my temple. If they break their contract, refer to the second Rule.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #1

name: Wealthy Whelp
raw: Ability: Moneymaker.

name: Zealot
raw: Sweep. Action: Apply Pyregel 5 to enemy units.

name: Ancient Synergy
raw: Deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to 2x the number of spells in your deck, three times.
lore: When mages channel the energy of the Titan, it is often released uncontrollably and violently at first. It takes many years of studying to control the flow, and while I’ve studied with the Stygian for a long time, the power still escapes me.

name: Coldcaelia
raw: Sweep. Strike: Apply Frostbite 6 to the attacked unit.

name: Crypt Builder
raw: Offering. Attuned. Retreat the front enemy unit and deal 80 damage.
lore: Massive hammers were used to seal the Titan in its crypt. Requiring the strength of multiple Guards to swing true, these tools have not been moved since their last use.

name: Crystalline Seeds
raw: Consume. Apply Frostbite 8 to enemy units.
lore: I’ve been able to capture shards of ice from the now-frozen sea and distill them into seed crystals, making the instantaneous freezing of objects even easier.

name: Cuttlehex
raw: Ability: Freeze Ray.

name: Deep Offering
raw: Consume. Discard your hand. Draw 5.
lore: From what I can tell, the resting place of the Unnamed spans the length of the Styx Sea. So, the Stygian have created shrines all over the seafloor to offer sustenance and other treasures to the sleeping Titan.

name: Drain
raw: Apply Sap 3. Discard a card at random.
lore: While the Guard claims that the Titan still sleeps, it seems to show a base level awareness when it is near another soul, helping its kin and hurting everyone else. I’ve yet to be subjected to either, so I can’t say which I am considered.

name: Eel Gorgon
raw: Incant: Gain Multistrike 1. Resolve: Remove all status effects.

name: Energy Siphon
raw: Apply Spell Weakness 1.
lore: Lodestones require direct operation to absorb the energy gained from any living beings around them. Through mechanisms I’ve not been able to understand, the energy retrieved is many times the source’s power.

name: Flash Freeze
raw: Deal 3 damage. Apply Frostbite 8.
lore: After the freezing of Hell, the Stygian Sea’s weather became much more erratic. Instant freezes are now frequent occurrences, much to the dismay of anyone unlucky enough to be caught in their icy grasp.

name: Forgone Power
raw: Apply Frostbite 8 to the front enemy unit. Discard a card at random.
lore: The Martyr speaks of the power a name has over the soul, that the Titan released its name for the good of Heaven, Hell, and Humans. Perhaps the same practice observed by the Stygian Guard is an evolution of this and grants them some minimal power as well.

name: Freeze Ray
raw: Apply Frozen to a card in hand.

name: Frenzied Swarm
raw: Apply Dazed 1 to enemy units. Discard your hand.
lore: When generous offerings are made to the Titan, groups of Winged often attempt to take the treasures for themselves. This makes them perfect prey for the swarms of Sirens waiting in the shadows.

name: Frostpiercer
raw: Strike: Apply Frostbite equal to half the damage dealt.

name: Frozen Lance
raw: Deal 10 damage to the front enemy unit.
lore: An ancient relic of a time before the Covenant. When I first came to the Stygian Sea, every resident of the Ring carried one to aid in their defense of the reigning Titan. There still lies some magic within the surrounding ice.

name: Gifts for a Guard
raw: Consume. Draw 3 damage spells and apply Consume, +30 Magic Power, and 0 Ember.
lore: Induction into the Guard is considered each Stygian’s last step before becoming a fully mature member of the Sea. They are asked to give up all possessions and only carry the tools of their creed. A different life than I would prefer to lead, but most likely much more honorable.

name: Glacial Seal
raw: Incant: Apply Frostbite 2 to enemy units.

name: Guard of the Unnamed
raw: Incant: Gain Armor 3.

name: Guardian Stone
raw: Incant: Apply Armor 1 to friendly units.

name: Guardian’s Amulet
raw: Offering. Apply Sap 2 to enemy units.
lore: Given only to the most respected of Guardians, these amulets were used both to identify and to protect the keepers of the Titan Monuments. As the only Stygian allowed to interact directly with the Titan, these Guardians wore the amulets to shield themselves from the Titan’s immense power.

name: Harness the Titan
raw: Apply +10 Magic Power to spells in hand.
lore: “When the Titan whose name has been sealed is released again, the Sea shall be illuminated with its awesome power.” - Tethys Titansbane’s account of the Titan’s return to our defense.

name: Helical Crystalis
raw: Deal 35 damage to the front enemy unit, twice.
lore: Physical combat has never been a strong suit of the Stygian Guard. Thankfully, their control of the energy coming from the Unnamed has made them deadly protectors of the inner Rings of Hell.

name: Hoarfrost Effigy
raw: Transfer all Frostbite on this floor to a unit, then double the amount of Frostbite.
lore: Even before the freeze, the granite monuments of the Titan dotting the sea were cold structures. Now they’ve become permanently frozen fixtures of the seascape, ominous presences easily recognizable by their sharp profiles.

name: Ice and Pyre
raw: Pyrebound. Attuned. Deal 90 damage to the front enemy unit.
lore: Having only limited control over the elements, the Stygian have learned to harness the energy of the Pyre and freeze it for even greater impact. Unfortunately, we’ve only been able to perfect this defense within a limited range.

name: Ice Tornado
raw: Permafrost. Deal 30 damage to a random enemy unit, three times.
lore: The brutal ecosystem of the Stygian Sea has evolved into a favorable place for tornadoes to destroy anything standing above the surface of the water. Thankfully for the Guard, their gills allow them to take refuge beneath the waves.

name: Icestorm
raw: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy unit, five times.
lore: When Hell was frozen, the Stygian Sea was cursed with an eternal storm, making my travel across it near impossible. Fortunately, I was later saved by the Guard, but the invaders of Hell were not so lucky.

name: Icy Cilophyte
raw: Sweep. Strike: Apply Spell Weakness 1 to the attacked unit.

name: Lodestone Totem
raw: Incant: Apply Sap 1 to enemy units.

name: Molluscmage
raw: Conduit 10.

name: Nameless Siren
raw: Incant: Gain Rage 3.

name: Offering Monument
raw: Incant: Draw +1 next turn.

name: Offering Token
raw: Draw 1. Discard 1.
lore: Making offerings to the Unnamed Titan has become a religious experience among the Stygian Guard. These offerings are made with such frequency that I helped to create tokens to represent a Guard’s offering to the Titan and simplify the process.

name: Preserve
raw: Permafrost. Apply Frozen to a card in your hand.
lore: Many precious artifacts of Hell were frozen when the Pyre was destroyed. Thankfully, this did not diminish their power, but only rendered their energy dormant until I am able to release them from their icy prison.

name: Resurgence I
raw: Remove Stasis and gain +6 attack and +6 health per Shard. Removes ability on use.

name: Resurgence II
raw: Remove Stasis and gain +10 attack and +10 health per Shard. Removes ability on use.

name: Resurgence III
raw: Remove Stasis and gain +15 attack and +15 health per Shard. Removes ability on use.

name: Runespeak I
raw: Draw a damage spell and grant it +5 Magic Power.

name: Runespeak I
raw: Draw a damage spell and grant it +10 Magic Power.

name: Runespeak III
raw: Draw a damage spell and grant it +15 Magic Power.

name: Siren of the Sea
raw: Incant: +3 Attack and +3 Health.

name: Siren’s Song
raw: Pyrebound. At the start of combat, Ascend non-boss enemy units on this floor and apply Dazed 3.
lore: I’ve heard no song as beautiful or as deadly as that of the Sirens of the Stygian. Their luring voices can disarm even the most hardened of hearts.

name: Solgard the Martyr
raw: Incant: Gain Shard 1.

name: Spike of the Stygian
raw: Consume. Apply 1 X Sap and 5 X Frostbite.
lore: The Stygian Guard was formed with our Rail of the Covenant, created by Tethys to protect the sealed Unnamed Titan. The Guard was wary of our Covenant from the beginning, worried that it would make the Pyre vulnerable to outside attacks. Unfortunately, they were correct.

name: Titan Sentry
raw: Revenge: Apply Frostbite 3 to enemy units.

name: Titan’s Gratitude
raw: Attuned. Deal 60 damage to the front enemy unit. Discard a card at random.
lore: From what Tethys has told me, the Unnamed below is not dead, but it is also not quite alive. The Stygian take responsibility for its well-being by providing sustenance, in return for occasional protection in the form of expelled energy.

name: Titanstooth
raw: Offering. Deal 5 damage to enemy units and apply Frostbite 10.
lore: Ceremonial spears are given to the Stygian Guard to aid them in their protection of the Unnamed’s resting place. Originally just part of tradition, these spears have recently become essential in our defense of Hell.

name: Unnamed Tome
raw: Permafrost. Consume. Apply Mute 3 to enemy units.
lore: When the Titan was finally put to rest, the Stygian Guard was formed. Tethys and I wrote this tome to record the existence of the Unnamed Titan and prophesize its return.

name: Urchin Spines
raw: Consume. Apply Spell Weakness 2 to enemy units.
lore: Electrified urchins swarm around the openings of the Titan’s seafloor resting place. Their spines shock any predators, providing a natural defense in the dangerous depths of the sea. Unbeknownst to Tethys, I collected some of these specimens for my studies.

name: Alloyed Construct
raw: Inert. Multistrike 1. Fuel 2. Gorge: Gain Fuel 1.

name: Antumbra Assault
raw: Deal 5 damage. Slay: Add 2 uncommon or rare Morsel units to your hand.
lore: As the first line of defense in the Crucible, Morsels will rocket towards an intruder, often sacrificing themselves in the process. If they succeed in their defense, they live to mine another day.

name: Antumbra Morsel
raw: Eaten: Eater gains +9 Health.

name: Blazing Bolts
raw: Purge. Deal 40 damage to a random enemy unit, twice. Add a stronger version of this card to your discard.
lore: Constructed bolts I gifted to the Umbra to dig deeper into the stone. When Morsels cannot break through it, these white-hot steel bolts should get the job done.

name: Blazing Bolts
raw: Deal 40 damage to a random enemy unit, four times.
lore: Constructed bolts I gifted to the Umbra to dig deeper into the stone. When Morsels cannot break through it, these white-hot steel bolts should get the job done.

name: Blazing Bolts
raw: Purge. Deal 60 damage to the front enemy unit. Add a stronger version of this card to your discard.
lore: Constructed bolts I gifted to the Umbra to dig deeper into the stone. When Morsels cannot break through it, these white-hot steel bolts should get the job done.

name: Cannibalize
raw: Sacrifice. Add 3 uncommon or rare Morsel units to your hand.
lore: Despite being a hive-minded creature, the Umbra Shroud still falls victim to the petty squabbles observed in the other clans. It’s unclear how this hive-minded creature can argue with itself, but the ensuing scuffles can be deadly and something I’ve learned to detect and avoid.

name: Cave In
raw: Descend all units.
lore: I’ve only seen the aftermath, but when a level of the Crucible collapses, very few Morsels survive. The Umbra don’t even care to check for survivors, choosing instead to spawn new Morsels.

name: Chomp
raw: Destroy a friendly unit and gain +15 attack and +15 health. Triggers Gorge and Eaten.

name: Crucible Collector
raw: Gorge: Gain Lifesteal 1.

name: Crucible Extension
raw: +4 Capacity.
lore: The number of Morsels within the Crucible seems to be endless, making the work they accomplish proceed near instantaneously. Should I need to do future work on the Boneshaker, I will remember to take this into account.

name: Crucible Warden
raw: Gorge: Gain Damage Shield 1.

name: Ember Cache
raw: Consume: Add 3 Excavated Ember cards to your discard pile.
lore: I created fortified steel boxes to house the dormant Ember mined in the Crucible, increasing its effectiveness through pressure and time.

name: Ember Forge
raw: +2 Ember per turn.

name: Engine Upgrade
raw: -1 Capacity. +1 Ember per turn.
lore: A substantial upgrade to the furnaces in the Boneshaker will eventually be necessary to ensure more efficient energy output. These upgrades will require considerable room to function, though.

name: Excavation Eruption
raw: Deal 25 damage to a random enemy unit, three times. Slay: Gain 2 Ember.
lore: With little regard for their own lives, these Morsels seem to explode carelessly in the mines, paying no mind to the possible consequences of their actions. I’ve seen this backfire on more than one occasion...

name: Feast
raw: Trigger feeding on friendly units with Eaten.
lore: Gorgers patrol the mines to collect errant Morsels, consuming them to return them back to the Shroud. They take great pleasure in their purpose, often consuming more Morsels than necessary.

name: Forever Consumed
raw: Deal 80X damage to the front enemy unit.
lore: Of a collective mind, the massive Umbra Shroud can wreak devastating damage upon the unfortunate soul who has been targeted by its wrath. On the one occasion I was witness to such an event, I was unable to return to the Crucible for months, afraid of the slightest chance it could happen to me.

name: Furnace Tap
raw: Consume. Apply Multistrike 1 and Emberdrain 4.
lore: Much to my dismay, the Umbra are able to withstand the heat output from the furnaces on the Boneshaker, allowing them to commune with its power and use it for themselves - at the cost of energy to the train.

name: Gem Trove
raw: Apply Damage Shield 1 to friendly units. Add 3 uncommon or rare Morsel units to your hand.
lore: It is said that the Crucible was formed when the Pyre first ignited, molding and melting the nearby ground to create endless, winding caverns. The Umbra have done their best to direct me through these tunnels, but the maze of caves has still been enough to trap me for days at a time.

name: Glutton's Maw
raw: Ability: Chomp.

name: Grovel
raw: Apply Damage Shield 1. Add 2 uncommon or rare Morsel units to your hand.
lore: Some errant Morsels, in an effort to please the Wardens, will offer their valuable jewels to try and get in their good graces. This behavior has been noted for future bribes that occur within the Boneshaker.

name: Immortal Trade
raw: Apply Lifesteal 4 and Emberdrain 2 to a friendly unit.
lore: An unfortunate outcome of our invention, Void consumption has become an addictive practice amongst the Umbra. When that no longer satiates their hunger, the entire replacement of self with these Void shards becomes the only way to gain any satisfaction.

name: Kindle
raw: Consume. Gain 2 X Ember.
lore: The Umbra Shroud mines the depths of the Crucible, creating more vents to the surface above. These allow the ember below to burn ever more fiercely, and when applied to the Boneshaker, the same technique has allowed us to increase our fuel efficiency for short amounts of time.

name: Magma Morsel
raw: Eaten: Eater gains +9 Attack.

name: Making of a Morsel
raw: Add a Morsel Miner to your hand.
lore: Only the most trusted of Morsels are allowed to mine the most precious of metals. Even fewer are allowed to forge the valuable creations of the Umbra Shroud. So, to be allowed into these sacred forges was an honor indeed.

name: Mine Collapse
raw: Deal 3 X damage. Slay: Gain 2 Ember.
lore: While Morsels seem to be quick workers in their mine, they do not appear to be the most intelligent and have been the cause of many easily avoided accidents. I can only hope this will not be the case aboard the train.

name: Morsel Excavator
raw: Eaten: Eater gains +6 Attack and Lifesteal 1.

name: Morsel Jeweler
raw: Eaten: Eater gains +6 Health and Damage Shield 1.

name: Morsel Miner
raw: Eaten: Eater gains +9 Attack and +9 Health.

name: Morsel-Made
raw: Hunger: Feed on units with Eaten. Gorge: +4 Attack and +4 Health.

name: Morselmaker
raw: Resolve: Summon an Antumbra Morsel and a Magma Morsel.

name: Morselmaster
raw: When you summon a Morsel unit on this floor, create a copy.

name: Overgorger
raw: Gorge: +2 Attack permanently.

name: Packed Morsels
raw: Consume. Add 3 uncommon or rare Morsel units to your hand.
lore: Through an unusual course of events, I’ve found that bottling many Morsels together allows them to be easily transported to quickly provide labor where it’s needed. It also had the added benefit of soothing the little creatures.

name: Perils of Production
raw: Apply Rage 3 and Emberdrain 2 to a friendly unit. Gain 3 Ember.
lore: To power the Constructs of the Crucible, the Umbra Shroud feeds them excavated fuel. If fed mined Ember, the furnaces go into overdrive, working doubly hard at the cost of even more Ember. This discovery was crucial in the construction of the furnaces within the Boneshaker.

name: Plink
raw: Deal 2 damage to a random enemy unit, twice. Slay: Add a cmommon or uncommon Morsel unit to your hand.
lore: The Primordium does not speak through words but through floods of feeling. The bounds of its mind seem endless. It’s no wonder that the ultimate split of the Primordium created a varying number of personalities, not the least of which are my friendly Morsels.

name: Primordium
raw: Buffet 3. Eaten: Add this unit's Attack and Health to the eater.

name: Prism Retrieval
raw: Consume. Draw a unit and apply +5 X Attack and -X Ember.
lore: Prism stones have the unique ability to refract both light and space, providing protection and creating matter from nothing. I’ve been able to reverse engineer this power to transport objects and beings across small distances.

name: Prismal Dust
raw: Consume. Apply 1 X Damage Shield.
lore: The dust gathered from mining Prism stones can be collected to create a similar, though less effective, defensive support around the owner.

name: Retch
raw: Return eaten units to your hand.
lore: Even the Shroud knows little restraint, sometimes consuming Morsels when, as far as I can tell, no hunger remains. This compulsion, unfortunately, can lead to… ”involuntary expulsion.”

name: Rubble Morsel
raw: Eaten: Gain 1 Ember. Eater gains +3 Attack and +3 Health.

name: Shadesplitter
raw: Add a common or uncommon Morsel unit to your hand.
lore: While the Umbra Shroud cannot do any physical labor on its own, it can create Antumbra Morsels to follow simple instructions and extract the full value of the Crucible. The splitting of the Shroud is like nothing I’ve ever seen before, and, frankly, prefer not to see again.

name: Shadoweater
raw: Gorge: Restore 10 health. Deal 20 damage to enemy units.

name: Shroud Mitosis
raw: Create 3 copies of a friendly Morsel unit.
lore: I thought that only the Umbra could split themselves off into more Morsels, but it seems that the Antumbra can create even more copies of themselves. I guess that’s why there’s a saying about a Morsel in a dark mine...

name: Shroud Spike
raw: Consume. Trigger feeding on a friendly Morsel unit 2 X times.
lore: The Umbra Shroud was the first clan to agree with me that the Rail was crucial to the survival of Hell. This alliance proved my proposed Covenant’s importance to the other clans.

name: Space Prism
raw: Consume. +1 Capacity on this floor.
lore: In addition to their ability to refract light for defensive use, Prism Stones can bend the space around them, creating something out of nothing.

name: Umbra Stone
raw: Consume. Apply Trample.
lore: As a single mind, the Umbra had no need for written text. But when I finally discovered them, they created a language to converse with me and the other lowly residents of Hell.

name: Void Binding
raw: Apply Damage Shield 2, Rage 6, and Emberdrain 3.
lore: When Void shards were first found, they were considered to be of little value. So, they were collected and dumped to the depths of the Crucible. Later, the Umbra and I found that the shards can mimic the effects of any nearby gems, making them incredibly useful tools if bound directly to the body.

name: Amorous Enoki
raw: Rally: Apply Regen 1 and +1 Health to friendly units.

name: Balmabello
raw: Regen 6: Spikes 6. Extinguish: Apply this unit's Buff stacks to friendly units.

name: Cheery Deathcap
raw: Summon: Apply Decay 7 to enemy units.

name: Cluster Colonel
raw: Armor 10. Resolve: Spawn 4.

name: Contagious
raw: Consume. Enemy units Propagate 4. Add a copy of this card to your discard pile.
lore: The Angels once had an outpost where the roots of the Wild Woods met the sands of Limbo. That is, until the Fatal Elm decided it had had enough of their presence and released its spores.

name: Deadly Variant
raw: Consume Apply Decay equal to 5x Sap.
lore: The angel tried to escape the frenzy of battle but it was too late. The Fatale Elm had its spores in him. Soon, they would eat away at him and transform his body until he was more fungus than flesh.

name: Deathcapped Prophet
raw: Rally: Draw +1 next turn.

name: Dig Deep
raw: Spawn 1. For every 10 cards in your deck Spawn 1 more.
lore: “Come sit with us in the shade. Don’t worry, we won’t hurt you.”

name: Eager Conscript
raw: Spawn 1.
lore: You never fight just one shroomfolk. Beneath Hell’s topsoil is an army that can decay the mightiest of oaks.

name: Enchantrelle
raw: Rally: Apply Sap 1 to enemy units.

name: Evergrowth
raw: Apply Regen 3 and Sap 3.

name: Fertile Ground
raw: Consume. Spawn 1. Spawn 1 more for each card in your consume pile.
lore: “Poor soldier. We’ll put him back together,” whispered the fungi beneath the battlefield. “Your body will be a perfect place for us to grow.”

name: Fetch
raw: Add a random equipment with Ephemeral to your hand and apply -1 Ember.

name: Funguy in a Suit
raw: Consume. Spawn 3. Apply Armor to Funguy equal to 4x Troop.
lore: “I’ll be the arm!” said one mushroom. “And I’ll be the head!” said another. A small voice spoke from the bottom of the armor, “Why do I have do be down here?”

name: Glow Up
raw: Advance. Propagate 2.
lore: The Lantern knight giggled. A spa day and a makeover was exactly what he needed to lift his spirits.

name: Gooey Flask
raw: Consume. Apply Sap 2 to enemy units.
lore: The shroomfolk harvest the sap of the Fatal Elm when the leaves are at their most putrid. Once boiled, the sap becomes a tasty syrup that makes you want to curl up beneath a root and sleep.

name: Green Recruit
raw: Extinguish: Spawn 4.

name: Grow Room
raw: All units Propagate 1 at the end of the turn.
lore: “Do you think they’ll be angry that we’re in here?” whispered a small crimini. “If they are,” began his brother, “We’ll take care of them.”

name: Infectory
raw: Spawn 1 when a unit without Troop dies.
lore: “Thanks for the ride!” cried the funguy as they leapt from the demon’s torso. The angel gurgled in horror.

name: Inhale
raw: Deal 10 damage. Slay: Spawn 2.
lore: Even the smallest shroomfolk have found ways to defend themselves. Some, when inhaled, consume the lungs of their victims from the inside out.

name: Loamcoat
raw: Resolve: Gain Regen 1. Propagate 2.
lore: The dapperling special ops unit knows the importance of good soil to a shroom’s performance. They went one step further and found a way to bring soil to the battlefield.

name: Maneating
raw: Apply Sap 2 and Decay 5 to a unit.

name: Maneating II
raw: Apply Sap 3, Decay 10, and Mute 1 to a unit.

name: Maneating III
raw: Apply Sap 4, Decay 15, and Mute 2 to a unit.

name: Mitosis Cap
raw: Celebrate: Gain a permanent copy of this unit. Cannot be equipped to Champion or Cardless units.
lore: Death is an opportunity to make a new, better version of yourself. This is a lesson many have known for as long as the roots of the Fatal Elm are deep.

name: Morel Mistress
raw: Etch: Apply Decay 8 to enemy units.

name: Mulch
raw: Consume. Draw +1 next turn. For every 15 cards in your deck, draw +1 more.
lore:
We grow in the shadow of Death.
—old Underlegion saying

name: Mushroom Cloud
raw: Consume. Sacrifice 1 Funguy. Deal 10 damage and apply Decay 10 to enemy units.
lore: “PORCINI GO BOOM!”

name: Mushy Room
raw: Apply Sap 3 to enemy units at the end of combat.
lore:
“Do you think they’ll make a wonderful perfume once the fungus is done with them?”
—Madame Lionsmane

name: Pandemic
raw: Consume. Apply Decay 8 and Sap 2. Add a copy of this card to your discard pile.
lore: “I know she’s our enemy but I just can’t help myself, I’m in love!” said the angel. “You too?! I feel as if I’ve been infected with love!” hissed his captain.

name: Pox
raw: Consume. Deal 20 damage and apply Decay 10 to all units.
lore: The soldiers moved with uncertain steps towards the Fatal Elm. “Pray to your gods,” came a whisper from beneath the mulch. Spore clouds erupted. “For you are to receive the Mushroom’s Kiss.”

name: Prickly Puffball
raw: Revenge: Apply Decay 5 to the attacker.

name: Proliferate
raw: Consume. Propagate 2 on all units.
lore: Within moments, the shroomfolk had devoured the demon’s hand and began consuming their way toward his head.

name: Rot
raw: Deal 15 damage. Apply Decay 15.
lore: When he drew his hand back from the tree’s roots, he found spores had settled on his skin like dust. First, he felt warm, then hot. Until his limb was engulfed in the unbearable pain of rotting alive.

name: Spawning Pods
raw: Consume. Spawn 5.
lore: “Finally! We’re free!” cried the first young mushroom. “What do you want to do first?” asked the second. “I don’t know, is there any mulch to eat?” answered the third.

name: Spike of the Legion
raw: Consume. Propagate 2 X.
